text: I lower my voice and press on: “What is this place, exactly? And why do you seem so familiar with it?”
Alicia doesn’t answer right away. She turns the token in her palm, as if weighing whether the words are worth letting out.
“Because I’ve been here before.”
“Once?”
She draws a shallow breath. “More than once.”
The residual glow of the underground chamber reflects in her eyes, like a thread about to snap. Her shoulders loosen for a brief instant, then tense again.
“That’s why you’re so practiced.”
“Mm.”
“Then when you said ‘we’ll need it again tomorrow’—you’re coming back?”
“They’ll leave traces.”
“I need to confirm whether this time… it happened ‘early.’”
She speaks plainly, but stops at what’s merely sufficient—deliberately skirting a deeper truth.
Lucia cuts in softly, “Master… please stop forcing yourself, okay? You don’t look well at all.”
“I’m fine.”
“You always say that.”
Lucia pulls the cloak tighter around her shoulders, the motion practiced—like she’s done this kind of tending many times before.
She finally pulls her gaze away from the formation marks and looks at me. “Let’s go back.”
“You shouldn’t have come out tonight… but since you did, consider yourself ‘lucky.’”
“Lucky?”
“You weren’t pulled in any deeper.”
She turns and heads out. Her steps are steady—but they feel like they’re being held together by her last bit of strength.
